messages.body:
Wed, 7 Jul 2004

Mr Usche

You are clearly unaware of the events of last week. 

I am Takumi Fujiwara, Mr Munglers chief mechanical engineer for his racing team Go Munglers! I have been given access to his personal correspondence.

Whether Mr Munglers informed you that he was a street racer is unknown to me, but a racer he was. Last Thursday, while racing down Mount Pocari, he attempted his trademark "gutter crawl" manoeuvre at around 110kph when a badger leaped out of the undergrowth and landed on the windscreen. Mr Munglers lost control, and the car flipped over the corner and over the barrier on the other side. The car rolled for several hundred meters before coming to a halt against the bottom of the cliff.

Mr Munglers is said to have died quickly, and thankfully so did the badger. The car was completely destroyed.

Please do not think badly of Mr Munglers. He was saying before the race that he intended to use some of the winnings (which would have been around $1.8million) to help a new friend in Africa with some financial opportunity. Perhaps this person was
you?

Yours regretfully,
Takumi

messages.body:
Mr Usche

Thanks for the information.

As we are not entirely aware of Mr Munglers dealings
before his horrific demise, please could you let us
know what exactly you were working on. Would it be
beneficial to our racing team?

I'm sure we can help each other out, but be aware that
Mr Munglers place on the team has now been taken by a
Mr Riddick Kawaii who is also our accountant. And
fiduciary combobulations that you need expediting
should be authoritatively countermanded by him.

For your information, Mr Munglers was buried at the
foot of Mt. Akina along with the badger and the clutch
pedal from his trusted 86.

What sort of car do you drive Mr Usche? If it has an
FR drive train I'm sure you are already practicing your
drifting for when you visit Japan.


I love you,
Takumi
